ChannelArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a channel.

Destination.description: The resource that receives events arriving from a channel.

properties.name: Location
properties.description: The ARN of a resource that receives events from a channel.

type.description: The ARN of a resource that receives events from a channel.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The type of destination for events arriving from a channel.

type.description: The type of destination for events arriving from a channel.

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

resource.description: A channel receives events from a specific source (such as an on-premises storage solution or application, or a partner event data source), and delivers the events to one or more event data stores. You use channels to ingest events into CloudTrail from sources outside AWS.

properties.name: Destinations
properties.description: One or more resources to which events arriving through a channel are logged and stored.

type.description: One or more resources to which events arriving through a channel are logged and stored.

properties.name: Source
properties.description: The ARN of an on-premises storage solution or application, or a partner event source.

type.description: The ARN of an on-premises storage solution or application, or a partner event source.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

type.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

attributes.description: A channel receives events from a specific source (such as an on-premises storage solution or application, or a partner event data source), and delivers the events to one or more event data stores. You use channels to ingest events into CloudTrail from sources outside AWS.
